intro: Stillingia paniculata, commonly known as the yellowroot or Indian root, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange roots and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the eastern United States. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and branched. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally by Indigenous peoples for various healing purposes.
